javaslang.match

Class Match<R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • javaslang.match.Match<R>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - The result type of the Match expression.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.function.Function<Object,R>

    public final class Match<R>
extends Object
implements java.util.function.Function<Object,R>
    A better switch for Java. A Match...
    • is lazy
    • is an expression, i.e. a Function<Object, R>
    • is able to match types, i.e. Matchs.caze((byte b) -> "a byte: " + b)
    • is able to match values, i.e. Matchs.caze(BigDecimal.ZERO, b -> "Zero: " + b)
    Example of a Match as partial function: 
     final Match<Number> toNumber = new Match.Builder<Number>()
     .caze((Integer i) -> i)
     .caze((String s) -> new BigDecimal(s))
     .build();
 final Number number = toNumber.apply(1.0d); // throws a MatchError
    Example of a Match as total function: 
     final Match<Number> toNumber = new Match.Builder<Number>()
     .caze((Integer i) -> i)
     .caze((String s) -> new BigDecimal(s))
     .orElse(() -> -1)
     .build();
 final Number number = toNumber.apply(1.0d); // result: -1

    The following calls are equivalent:

    • new Match.Builder<R>.caze(...).build().apply(obj)
    • new Match.Builder<R>.caze(...).apply(obj)
    • Matchs.caze(...).apply(obj)
    This class is not intended to be extended.
    See Also:
    Matchs

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        public R apply(Object obj)
        Applies an object to this matcher. This is the implementation of the Function interface.
        Specified by:
        apply in interface java.util.function.Function<Object,R>
        Parameters:
        obj - An object.
        Returns:
        The result when applying the given obj to the first matching case. If the case has a consumer, the result is null, otherwise the result of the underlying function or supplier.
        Throws:
        MatchError - if no Match case matches the given object and no default is defined via orElse().
        Try.Failure.NonFatal - if an error occurs executing the matched case.
